svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 23, 2024" date: "2024-03-22"
Eth News and Links
Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
* Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
Proposal to set default local block boost to 10% Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting
late 2024) EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance): added to Pectra EIP7547 IL
(inclusion lists) : considered for inclusion in Pectra, review in 4 weeks, doing both
maxEB + IL increases upgrade complexity and deprioritizes peerDAS EIP7659 increase
blob throughput proposal to increase to target of 8 & maximum of 16 blobs per block
(up from 3/6) over 4 months Light client proposals : EIP7658 light client data
backfill & EIP7657 sync committee slashings P2P proposals: network shards, IDONTWANT
control message & deprecate mplex
Latest all core devs – consensus (ACDC) call video . Notes from Christine Kim :
* Proposal to set default local block boost to 10%
Proposal to set default local block boost to 10%
* Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIP7251 maxEB (increase max
effective balance): added to Pectra EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists) : considered for
inclusion in Pectra, review in 4 weeks, doing both maxEB + IL increases upgrade
complexity and deprioritizes peerDAS EIP7659 increase blob throughput proposal to
increase to target of 8 & maximum of 16 blobs per block (up from 3/6) over 4 months
Light client proposals : EIP7658 light client data backfill & EIP7657 sync committee
slashings
Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024)
* EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance): added to Pectra
EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance): added to Pectra
* EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists) : considered for inclusion in Pectra, review in 4
weeks, doing both maxEB + IL increases upgrade complexity and deprioritizes peerDAS
EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists) : considered for inclusion in Pectra, review in 4 weeks,
doing both maxEB + IL increases upgrade complexity and deprioritizes peerDAS
* EIP7659 increase blob throughput proposal to increase to target of 8 & maximum of 16
blobs per block (up from 3/6) over 4 months
EIP7659 increase blob throughput proposal to increase to target of 8 & maximum of 16
* Light client proposals : EIP7658 light client data backfill & EIP7657 sync committee
* P2P proposals: network shards, IDONTWANT control message & deprecate mplex
P2P proposals: network shards, IDONTWANT control message & deprecate mplex
* EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance): Breakout call notes
EIP7251 maxEB (increase max effective balance):
* Breakout call notes
* EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists): Breakout call video and notes : plan to finalize proof
of concept (PoC) specs, begin client PoC implementations & interop on a devnet
Terence: changes to support blob transactions within existing IL design
EIP7547 IL (inclusion lists):
* Breakout call video and notes : plan to finalize proof of concept (PoC) specs, begin
client PoC implementations & interop on a devnet
Breakout call video and notes : plan to finalize proof of concept (PoC) specs, begin
* Terence: changes to support blob transactions within existing IL design
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* 🚨 Lido at 30.59% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
🚨 Lido at 30.59% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 66% majority
Coinbase migrated to ~50% Nethermind Geth vulnerability disclosed : all EL clients
updated to safe RPC limits Nethermind post mortem of January block processing issue
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% majority Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of
finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth 66% majority Coinbase migrated to ~50% Nethermind Geth
vulnerability disclosed : all EL clients updated to safe RPC limits Nethermind post
mortem of January block processing issue
Execution layer: Geth 66% majority
* Coinbase migrated to ~50% Nethermind
Coinbase migrated to ~50% Nethermind
* Geth vulnerability disclosed : all EL clients updated to safe RPC limits
Geth vulnerability disclosed : all EL clients updated to safe RPC limits
* Nethermind post mortem of January block processing issue
Nethermind post mortem of January block processing issue
* Consensus layer: Prysm 38% majority
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% majority
* Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
* Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America &
Layer 1
* Eric Conner & Mariano Conti campaign to raise the gas limit to 40M
Eric Conner & Mariano Conti campaign to raise the gas limit to 40M
* Calldata.pics : live charts of calldata & blob usage
Calldata.pics : live charts of calldata & blob usage
* ethPandaOps: Attacknet : inject faults into a devnet, uses Kurtosis & Chaos Mesh
Dencun upgrade analysis : open questions on reorg rate, attestation effectiveness &
safely increasing blob parameters
ethPandaOps:
* Attacknet : inject faults into a devnet, uses Kurtosis & Chaos Mesh
Attacknet : inject faults into a devnet, uses Kurtosis & Chaos Mesh
* Dencun upgrade analysis : open questions on reorg rate, attestation effectiveness &
* Dencun diary : contributor reflections, future priorities & improvement suggestions
Dencun diary : contributor reflections, future priorities & improvement suggestions
Client Releases
* Consensus layer: Lighthouse v5.1.2 : hotfix for block lookup duplicate requests and
to stop propagation of slashings for slashed attesters
Consensus layer:
* Lighthouse v5.1.2 : hotfix for block lookup duplicate requests and to stop
propagation of slashings for slashed attesters
* Execution layer: Erigon v2.59.0 : post Dencun fixes Reth v0.2.0-beta.3 : fix
critical in static files that could lead to inconsistent storage state
Execution layer:
* Erigon v2.59.0 : post Dencun fixes
Erigon v2.59.0 : post Dencun fixes
* Reth v0.2.0-beta.3 : fix critical in static files that could lead to inconsistent
storage state
Reth v0.2.0-beta.3 : fix critical in static files that could lead to inconsistent
Research
* Discouragement attack against centralized validator sets
Layer 2
* Optimism fault proofs live on OP Sepolia testnet
EIPs/Standards
* EIPs: EIP7657 : Sync committee slashings EIP7658 : Light client data backfill
EIP7659 : Stepwise blob throughput increase
EIPs:
* EIP7657 : Sync committee slashings
EIP7657 : Sync committee slashings
* EIP7658 : Light client data backfill
EIP7658 : Light client data backfill
* EIP7659 : Stepwise blob throughput increase
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7656 : Generalized token-linked contracts
ERCs (application layer):
* ERC7656 : Generalized token-linked contracts
Stuff for developers
* Etherscan contract verification updated : multichain verification with single API
key and suggest name tags, labels & URL
Etherscan contract verification updated : multichain verification with single API key
and suggest name tags, labels & URL
* OpenSea Seaport v1.6 : adds Seaport hooks
OpenSea Seaport v1.6 : adds Seaport hooks
* 555 NFT : onchain audio & SVG
555 NFT : onchain audio & SVG
* Guide to implementing stateful invariant testing with Halmos
Guide to implementing stateful invariant testing with Halmos
* Ethernaut-cli (tool box): built on Hardhat tasks, AI requires OpenAI API key; beta
Ethernaut-cli (tool box): built on Hardhat tasks, AI requires OpenAI API key; beta
* Ec (Rust library): convert bytes into minimal number of blobs
Ec (Rust library): convert bytes into minimal number of blobs
* Lodestar Prover : middleware wrapper around light client for dapps
Lodestar Prover : middleware wrapper around light client for dapps
* CTFs: OpenZeppelin Ethernaut CTF 2024 challenges & solutions
CTFs:
* OpenZeppelin Ethernaut CTF 2024 challenges & solutions
* Cyfrin Updraft adds web3 DevOps & Assembly & Formal Verification courses
Cyfrin Updraft adds web3 DevOps & Assembly & Formal Verification courses
* Reminder: Goerli testnet sunsets Apr 17, most validators have shutdown, opportunity
to research long-range attacks Use Sepolia testnet for application layer testing
Reminder: Goerli testnet sunsets Apr 17, most validators have shutdown, opportunity to
research long-range attacks
* Use Sepolia testnet for application layer testing
Security
* Super Sushi Samurai $4.8M exploit on Blast via transferring to self to double
balance, white hat
Super Sushi Samurai $4.8M exploit on Blast via transferring to self to double balance,
white hat
* Dolomite $1.8M exploit of old contracts, revoke approvals
Dolomite $1.8M exploit of old contracts, revoke approvals
* ParaSwap Augustus V6 contract vulnerability , white hat, revoke approvals
ParaSwap Augustus V6 contract vulnerability , white hat, revoke approvals
* AirDAO LP drained via social engineering
AirDAO LP drained via social engineering
* Finding an ERC4626 vault reentrancy , $3M was at risk
Finding an ERC4626 vault reentrancy , $3M was at risk
* Trail of Bits: weAudit (VSCode extension), collaborative note taking & highlight
code regions
Trail of Bits: weAudit (VSCode extension), collaborative note taking & highlight code
regions
Ecosystem
* Pascal Caversaccio: Ethereum cypherpunk manifesto
Pascal Caversaccio: Ethereum cypherpunk manifesto
* ETHGlobal London hackathon winners
ETHGlobal London hackathon winners
Enterprise
* Enterprise Ethereum Alliance new leadership team: Karen Scarbrough - Executive
Director, Paul Brody - Chairperson and Vanessa Grellet joins board
Enterprise Ethereum Alliance new leadership team: Karen Scarbrough - Executive
* Google search for an ENS address shows Ether balance
Google search for an ENS address shows Ether balance
Job Listings
* Waku is hiring! Protocol Engineer , Waku SDK Software Engineer & Researcher
Waku is hiring! Protocol Engineer , Waku SDK Software Engineer & Researcher
* IFT / Logos : ZK Researcher (Nomos); ZK Researcher (Vac) & ZK Engineer x2
IFT / Logos : ZK Researcher (Nomos); ZK Researcher (Vac) & ZK Engineer x2
* Certora is hiring: Head of Product , SR-Rust , Compiler Developer & FV Wizard
Certora is hiring: Head of Product , SR-Rust , Compiler Developer & FV Wizard
* Devcon: Community Supporter , Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
Devcon: Community Supporter , Production Magician & Volunteer Coordinator
* 👾OpenZeppelin seeks Security Researchers in Canada , Australia , LatAm & USA
👾OpenZeppelin seeks Security Researchers in Canada , Australia , LatAm & USA
* TechOps are looking for DevOps . Work on projects such as MakerDAO.
TechOps are looking for DevOps . Work on projects such as MakerDAO.
* ChainSafe seek a Head of Protocol Engineering
ChainSafe seek a Head of Protocol Engineering
Job listings: $600 for 4 issues (75 char limit). Pay using 3cities. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 16.4 to 121.8 gwei, with 32.4 gwei average Zero
net issuance currently at 22.8 gwei 7k ETH net burn this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 16.4 to 121.8 gwei, with 32.4 gwei average
* Zero net issuance currently at 22.8 gwei
Zero net issuance currently at 22.8 gwei
* 7k ETH net burn this week
7k ETH net burn this week
* ETHUSD : $3,107 - $3,757, currently $3,305
ETHUSD : $3,107 - $3,757, currently $3,305
* ETHBTC : currently 0.052 (Flippening at ~0.16)
ETHBTC : currently 0.052 (Flippening at ~0.16)
Notable at app layer
* BlackRock USD institutional digital liquidity fund (BUIDL), stable token pays
dividends in tokens monthly for qualified investors
BlackRock USD institutional digital liquidity fund (BUIDL), stable token pays
* Nexus Mutual bundled protocol cover , protection for multiple protocols under a
single listing
Nexus Mutual bundled protocol cover , protection for multiple protocols under a single
listing
Regulation/business/tokens
* Ethereum is first (“profitable”) chain where burned transaction fees are greater
than lifetime issuance
Ethereum is first (“profitable”) chain where burned transaction fees are greater than
lifetime issuance
* Fortune: SEC issues subpoenas regarding dealings with EF EF removed warrant canary
from website in Feb 26 commit: “received a voluntary enquiry from a state authority
that included a requirement for confidentiality”
Fortune: SEC issues subpoenas regarding dealings with EF
* EF removed warrant canary from website in Feb 26 commit: “received a voluntary
enquiry from a state authority that included a requirement for confidentiality”
* SEC sanctioned for bad faith conduct in DEBT Box case
SEC sanctioned for bad faith conduct in DEBT Box case
* Genesis $21M settlement with SEC for charges of unregistered offer & sale of
securities
Genesis $21M settlement with SEC for charges of unregistered offer & sale of
General
* Polygon PoS added secp256r1 curve precompile (RIP7212)
Polygon PoS added secp256r1 curve precompile (RIP7212)
* GoFetch : side channel attack using data memory-dependent prefetchers in Apple
silicon
GoFetch : side channel attack using data memory-dependent prefetchers in Apple silicon
END OF SERVICE: plan to deprecate Week in Ethereum News
Editor: @abcoathup Follow @WeekinEthNews for the most clicked links Permalink:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-march-23-2024
Upcoming Dates of Note
(new/changes in bold )
* Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest conference & hackathon
Mar 27-30 – ETH Bucharest conference & hackathon
* Mar 29-31 – ETH Seoul hackathon
Mar 29-31 – ETH Seoul hackathon
* Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum virtual hackathon
Apr 5-26 – ETHGlobal Scaling Ethereum virtual hackathon
* Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference
Apr 5-7 – EthereumZuri.ch conference
* Apr 12-14 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
Apr 12-14 – ETHDam (Amsterdam) conference & hackathon
* Apr 16-18 – EY Global blockchain summit (London)
Apr 16-18 – EY Global blockchain summit (London)
* Apr 19-21 – ETH Tallinn hackathon
Apr 19-21 – ETH Tallinn hackathon
* Apr 23-May 7 – Gitcoin Grants 20
Apr 23-May 7 – Gitcoin Grants 20
* Apr 26-28 – ETHBoston hackathon & conference
Apr 26-28 – ETHBoston hackathon & conference
* May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney hackathon
May 3-5 – ETHGlobal Sydney hackathon
* May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
May 21-23 – DappCon (Berlin)
* May 24-26 – ETHBerlin hackathon
May 24-26 – ETHBerlin hackathon
* May 31-Jun 2 – ETHDublin hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 2 – ETHDublin hackathon & conference
* May 31-Jun 2 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
May 31-Jun 2 – ETHPrague conference & hackathon
* May 31-Jun 5 – ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
May 31-Jun 5 – ETH Belgrade hackathon & conference
* Jun 14 – EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
Jun 14 – EF EIP4844 data challenge deadline
* Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
Jul 8-11 – EthCC (Brussels) conference
* Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
Jul 12-14 – ETHGlobal Brussels hackathon
* Jul 26-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
Jul 26-30 – EDCON Tokyo conference
* Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
Aug 23-Sep 13 – ETHGlobal ETHOnline virtual hackathon
* Aug 29-31 – ETHAccra hackathon
Aug 29-31 – ETHAccra hackathon
* Sep 12-14 – NapulETH (Napoli)
Sep 12-14 – NapulETH (Napoli)
* Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
Sep 20-22 – ETHGlobal Singapore hackathon
* Oct 6-8 – ETHRome
Oct 6-8 – ETHRome
* Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
Oct 18-20 – ETHGlobal San Francisco hackathon
* Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
Nov 12-15 – Devcon 7 - Southeast Asia (Bangkok)
* Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
Nov 15-17 – ETHGlobal Bangkok hackathon
